Uses of Class
org.junit.rules.ExpectedException

  • Packages that use ExpectedException 
    Package Description
    org.junit.rules  

    • Uses of ExpectedException in org.junit.rules

      Methods in org.junit.rules that return ExpectedException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.expect(Class<? extends Throwable> type)
      Verify that your code throws an exception that is an instance of specific type.
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.expect(Matcher<?> matcher)
      Deprecated. 
      use org.hamcrest.junit.ExpectedException.expect()
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.expectCause(Matcher<?> expectedCause)
      Deprecated. 
      use org.hamcrest.junit.ExpectedException.expectCause()
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.expectMessage(Matcher<String> matcher)
      Deprecated. 
      use org.hamcrest.junit.ExpectedException.expectMessage()
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.expectMessage(String substring)
      Verify that your code throws an exception whose message contains a specific text.
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.handleAssertionErrors()
      Deprecated. 
      AssertionErrors are handled by default since JUnit 4.12. Just like in JUnit <= 4.10.
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.handleAssumptionViolatedExceptions()
      Deprecated. 
      AssumptionViolatedExceptions are handled by default since JUnit 4.12. Just like in JUnit <= 4.10.
      static ExpectedException ExpectedException.none()
      Returns a rule that expects no exception to be thrown (identical to behavior without this rule).
      ExpectedException ExpectedException.reportMissingExceptionWithMessage(String message)
      Specifies the failure message for tests that are expected to throw an exception but do not throw any.
